result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas James Hooyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:27 pm cases called-15cm214 & 16CM25. Defendant Thomas James Hooyman in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. Complaints stated on each matter, confirm receipt and waived formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2 on 15CM214. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads in Count 1 of 15CM214 & 16CM25. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 75 days WCJ, STAYED and placed on probation for a period of 12 months. If revoked with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 3 days served. CONDITIONS: AODA & Follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
from Atty Ulrich, Dated 3/24/2016 Re: Request to Quash the Warrant

Case called @ 10:44 a.m. Defendant Thomas James Hooyman in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Defendant has not received criminal complaint - the court will not arraign at this time.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Defendant has now received a copy of a criminal complaint. Court orders the cash bond of $500 previously ordered be amended to a $1500 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:55 am.
